abstract: Oil services company Baker Hughes reports that withdrawal of rigs from oil fields by energy companies have declined to its smallest drop in five weeks, signaling that collapse in drilling may be ending as crude oil prices recover.
lead_paragraph: Energy companies withdrew three rigs from oil fields this week, the smallest drop in five weeks, data showed on Friday.

headline.main: With Oil Prices Recovering, Rig Count Steadies
headline.print_headline: With Oil Prices Recovering, Rig Count Steadies

snippet: Energy companies withdrew three rigs from oil fields this week, the smallest drop in five weeks, data showed on Friday.
